text: As we all know, Disney has been a bit unoriginal for Disney standards. Remaking their classics(or having a spin off), sequels, and the like have been abundant in Disney, and other companies too.With the knowledge that Jungle Cruise is a Disney World ride like Pirates of the Caribbean, I went into this with both excitement and doubts. That said, Jungle Cruise was a worthy trip to the theater.The plot is headed by Emily Blunt(who was the titular character in Mary Poppins Returns) playing Lily, who is in search of a tree who's petals have the power to heal- making for a medical revolution. Along the way, she meets a jungle tour guide named Frank, played by Dwayne Johnson. After a deal, they work together to find the treasure.There is much to admire about Jungle Cruise, such as the cast. It also includes Paul Giamatti, and Disney Channel star Rapheal Alejandro had a couple of scenes. Even though I don't watch much of his work I must report that I perked up when he appeared.The cinematography is also well done, and very pleasing to look at. Some of it looked very real, even though some of it surely wasn't.Frank also tells many puns in the movie, most of which are in his first scene, in an attempt to amuse his tour guide attendants. To paraphrase one of them: "I had a cross eyed girlfriend once. We could never see eye to eye." As a lover of puns and corny jokes, they made me laugh hard.There are other funny bits as well, though this by definition is not a comedy. One line in the final scene made me and a friend crack up kind of obnoxiously and we quoted it a couple of times. I won't spoil that one, but Emily Blunt says it and it's a pun on profanity.Despite the joys Jungle Cruise offers, it did have it's criticisms. I mentioned the lack of orginality, though as someone who went to Disney World just once 13 years ago, that alone didn't bother me.While nothing really needed to be taken out, there were some moments that seemed to slow down the movie and sway my interest. I can't think of how I would change these moments, but I did feel antsy when this notion occurred.I did very much enjoy Jungle Cruise as a theatrical experience(Thanks to the pandemic, I haven't seen a movie on the Big Screen since Toy Story 4), but as for my recommendation for others, I would only suggest it for theatrical viewing or as a part of a Disney Plus subscription. I would not rush to buy it for a $20 DVD or $25 Blu-ray before doing either first. (I may own this but I am in no rush as of now.)That noted, with all things said and done, Jungle Cruise is a worthy watch despite it's shortcomings and is worth the "ride" either way.Note To Parents: While not too violent, please note the PG-13 rating before taking the really little ones to see this. It may be a little too intense in some areas.*If you enjoy this, please check out and (positively) vote on my other reviews by clicking on filmbuff-05706. I'd greatly appreciate it, dear reader! :)

title: Was rather disappointed
text: I had been waiting for many months for this movie to come out on DVD as the trailer I had seen looked really promising. To me the first half of the movie seem to replicate Indiana Jones movies. And then the second afternoon to pirates of the Caribbean. So that's all the creativity Disney has these days to copy other films? The movie was too long for my taste and the CGI was way overused and not that great. The worst part is that the producers trying really hard to create a romantic chemistry between the two main characters but it just did not happen. The kiss near the end was very cringe-worthy. You can tell it was awkward for both actors.

title: Amazing
text: What an amazing movie, with humor and adventure. Perfect cast with Dwayne Johnson and Emily Blunt. Love love love it!!

title: Movie mixture and just plain fun
text: Add The Mummy,Guardians of the Galaxy,Indiana Jones. Avatar with a little Tremors thrown in and you get Jungle Cruise. It starts out fun and continues throughout with a bit of an over reach for a few minutes but still well worth it.Really enjoyed having this type of movie back to just enjoy without any agenda or heavy philosophical issues.It's just fun. 😊Just plain fun.

title: So Disney, it's boring
text: TL;DR: Got bored. Knew it wouldn't get better, not wasting more time. Cast was fine. Direction was something else entirely.Long version:I grew up in love w pirates of the Caribbean and Swiss family Robinson and i loved both at the parks and loved the movies more as an adult. I have loved most of what Disney makes from the very beginning. Gave credit to movies i didn't personally like but saw the quality in them still. So i was surprised i actually couldn't stand this from the very beginning.The brief moments of funny were so heavy handed i couldn't enjoy it fully. The story is nothing I'm familiar with but that doesn't matter if the movie can't stand on its own. The whole thing was way too saccharin for us. Just everything about it. It was obviously made for kids, fine, per usual. But this is way over the top in some way. I can likely guess it's the Direction. Disney might be trying to form a new method. I've noticed this a few times over the years. This didn't time it didn't work for us.

title: Pretty solid Disney adventure movie
text: This was a very enjoyable film. The casting is perfect and the chemistry between the characters is what makes this film, mainly Dwayne Johnson and Emily Blunt which are great together.It remind me of the original Pirates of the Caribbean with a touch of the Brendan Fraiser Mummy and old classic period adventure films. And it totally works!The only questionable thing for me is that the german bad guy feels a little cartoony and flat , but it didn't bother me too much, it is Disney after all so is understandable.Is this gonna be the next big Disney cash-cow adventure franchise? Most probably yes.Is it the next Indiana Jones? Definetely not.Overall this is a really good family fun movie.

title: Should Have Been Way Way Shorter
text: Also, did this woman just throw away the chance to cure all diseases which she has been after for her entire life, just to save this 400 yo niba who actually wants to die and whom she just met a few weeks ago and now suddenly is in love with? Loooooool.

title: Perfect movie for the cinemas
text: Emily Blunt, Rock and Jack Whitehall are perfectly cast in this fun adventure Indiana Jones inspired movie! Worth going to the cinemas for!

title: Could have been a new Indiana Jones but
text: Too much comedy done on the cheap.It's to childlike. Emildy Blunt was wasted in this flic. She can do so much better as prooven in Sicario. This movie is female Indiana Jones like but has the ratios wrong. 20% less comedy and it would have been 50% better.

title: Delivers where it aims to.
text: A fun frolic through the jungle that delivers on what it sets out to do. A family adventure with a good turn from all the cast, nothing unpredictable or That's hasn't gone before so don't expect a movie going revelation, but it's fun and looks great, I enjoyed it and that's all that matters.

title: Decent movie
text: Watchable.. No need for the jack Whitehall character.. Although for him it's no change to his real persona. 🤷‍♂️

title: Absolute fun
text: The family thoroughly enjoyed this movie. The jokes were cute, the characters fun, the plot fantastical. It's a kid movie with some fun adult bits. It's been on repeat here and I'm not mad about it.

title: Run of a Mill story. Nothing special
text: Movie tries hard to be Indiana Jones but fails miserably. Emily Blunt as usual is Spectacular but script fails to hold on. I sat through this movie only because I felt mesmarized by Emily Blunt. She looks just amazing and natural in the role. Story line is usual boring one and Dwayne Johnson fails to impress.

title: Adventurous trip
text:
+ Good chemistry between main cast
+ Adventurous trip as expected
+ Some good story twists as not expected
+ The jungle full of life
+ Did I mention the good chemistry?

title: Cliched and uninteresting
text: Most boring film of 2021. A very by the numbers action flick where all these great actors seem devoid of their usual charisma. The action set pieces fail to get you excited and the CGI is used so much it becomes jarring. Even the Rock and Emily Blunt cant save this sinking ship of a film.

title: A fun watch :)
text: Perfect weekend movie!Light, fun, funny and keeps you engaged throughout. The cast and acting was on spot.

title: Off the Rail
text: The kids will surely love this classic Disney film but adult viewers will feel shortchanged from the over-abundance of corny bad jokes, cringey performances (Dwayne Johnson still can't act!) and underwhelming CGI's. Compared to the similarly flavoured Pirates of the Caribbean series, Disney at least got the balance right with the Pirates movies.

title: It's been a while since this type of experience!
text: A perfect mixture of Tomb Raider, The Mummy, Pirates of the Caribbean, and Indiana Jones. The film is filled with humor, action, charm, mystery, and excellent cinematography. Not so special but you will certainly have a great time watching it. Characters, twists, and casting are amazing. You need to put your brain aside with such films and just enjoy. Highly recommended!

title: Dissappointing In Everyway
text: The story line was very weak and disjointed with the movie jumping mindlessly between actions scenes. The tale of the movie was taken from a number of other movies resulting in nothing new. Also the comedy was just endless dad jokes which were not funny. The characters were extremely stereotyped and very predictable portrayed with very ordinary acting.This was not really a kids movie having a major homosexual theme. This theme now seems to have to be included in all children's movies made in the USA regardless of relevance. This so called revelation had nothing to do with the movie but was included to tick a box to appease the minority.Overall a very disappointing movie and which I would not show to children due to the high level adult themes.

title: Love a good adventure film
text: This movie was a fun ride from beginning to end. The casting and acting was great and, for me, so was the pacing.. This movie definitely paid homage to the classics and others that came before it on multiple occasions. Multiple scenes feel like small little love letters to films like The Mummy, Indiana Jones, Tomb Raider, Pirates of the Caribbean, all while being respectfully unique. I'd highly recommend this film to anyone who's a fan of the high adventure genre.

title: The rock
text: The rock plays himself in this movie sequel to jumanji 2, yes this is fast and jumanji 3.

title: Not a must see but might be a classic
text: A little long; but that's my only knock. This movie sticks all of the landings. Dwayne Johnson is taking the baton from Tom Cruise--a guanteed good time at the movies.

title: Old fashioned stale fare
text: This movie goes for a classic feel, yet ends up feeling outdated.There is less than zero chemistry between Blunt and the Rock and about the same amount of character development. Sure, there are a few zingers in there, but this movie should be pretty boring for anyone over the age of 11.As usual, not a single Portuguese speaking actor was cast. And, FFS, it's 2021, can we stop naming Brazilian locations and things in Spanish?

title: excellent must watch film
text: It has been a while since we had such fun watching a family film together. Jungle cruise has 2 of my favourite actors - Dwayne Johnson and Emily Blunt - who deliver smashing performances. Their on-screen chemistry is brilliant, and they display their individual passions clearly and credibly. There's a sweet love story here. The villain of the movie hearkens back to the moustache-twirling days of yore, with a ruthlessly driven mind played brilliantly by Jesse Plemons.The dialogue of the film is witty and entertaining, and remarkably sophisticated, tackling sensitive issues with taste and class. The special effects and settings are authentic and really well done. Set pieces are magnificent and breathtaking. You can almost feel the steamy heat of the Amazon in each scene. The supernatural aspect is a nice welcome twist, always. Just like the Pirates franchise, Disney really knows how to spin off classic theme park rides into excellent movies. The jungle cruise within cruise was a funny meta twist.There's a massive twist half way through the movie that absolutely nobody saw coming, which really changes the perspective on a major character. Bravo script writers. The soundtrack by James Newton Howard is epic in scale, reminiscent of earlier classic adventure films. This is an excellent must watch film.

title: Trilogy Material
text: What happens when you mix Pirates of the Caribbean with Indiana Jones (the first 3)? You get the Jungle Cruise.- that's the most I can say with out giving away any twists or spoilers.Emily Blunt, The Rock, and the rest of the casting was very solid. Expect many dead Pan one liners (it is the Jungle Cruise)Many call backs to the ride's one liners, and many Easter eggs from other Disney related movies (and parks)I didn't give this a 10 because I think the music was severely lacking. Yes, it was really cool hearing a rendition of Metallica's Nothing Else Matters, however The Rock could have had a much better theme track.

title: I waited a whole year for this!!!!
text: Big disappointment!! The worst story ever. The worst cast. The worst acting. The worst editing. The worst movie I HAVE EVER SEEN in years If not the worst. Disney should give up producing more of this live action shit that never gonna impress anyone. I can't believe I was sad when it got delayed. 2/10 and I am being generous cause I was so bored that I only continued it out of respect for Emily's effort.

title: Predictable
text: There's not much here to recommend it. It's been done before and the best version was the African Queen.

title: Pass on it..
text: The storyline was good but they should of had different casting than Dwayne Johnson and emily blunt since we have to watch them in every other movie that comes out.

title: Incredible movie
text: I wasn't expecting much but I was very much blown away by this awesome adventure movie.A movie defenetely worth seeing!Believe me! Go see this movie.

title: Too Long
text: Jungle Cruise is over 2 hours of relentless so called action with 1000 groan inducing quips by the Rock that get quite tiresome after the first half hour. It morphs from an action flick into some sort of weird Sci-Fi about an hour and a half in with something about snakes. Jungle cruise should have been edited down to a hour and twenty, but what we have is a terribly Long, unhinged, sack of Amazon feces. To say that it is a disappointment is an understatement, but on the other hand it's one of the Rock's best films.

title: Great fun!
text: Jungle Cruise is all the best parts of The Mummy and Pirates of the Caribbean together. Light and fun with some great one-liners. I definitely be watching it again soon.

title: An average run-of-the mill jungle adventure flick
text: If this movie came out in the early 2000s, it would have been considered half-decent. It's got the same vibe as The Mummy and Pirates of the Caribbean.But in 2021 where it's not been long after two Jumanji films set in the jungle (which also star Dwayne Johnson), was there even any need to make this film?Emily Blunt and Dwayne Johnson give respectable performances. But not enough to save the movie from a boring plot, boring villains and a somewhat forced, cringe love story.All-in-all, a very forgetful movie which was lucky to snap up an Emily Blunt to even be involved in it.

title: Nice adventure movie
text: Finally a movie where Dwayne Johnson is not super annoying.. only in this movie Emily blunt is annoying.. for a Disney movie the animation was not very nice but yeah if it's a rainy day definitely go for it as it's quite amusing and I love adventure movies.

title: Boring
text: Wasn't that great. Ok, but, the story was boring. Seem like it was trying too hard.

title: Booga Booga garbage
text:
It should be entertaining for
an early Sunday morning when you are not fully awake, but even in that scenario, the movie is full of awful stereotypes that don't let you enjoy what should be an easy-going movie.If you have young kids, they may like the movie in the same way the would enjoy a rollercoaster. Don't think, just enjoy the ride.The acting is overall mediocre, except for Emily Blunt that gives a decent performance even with this limited Disney character.Dwayne Johnson... sorry, but just shut up, you're not a good actor nor funny.

title: Entertaining!
text: I usually sceptictal about Disney's movies (live action, movies). But I found Jungle Cruise is really fun and enjoyable to watch! Emily Blunt is stunning as always. Dwayne J., who usually I don't really like his movies, is very good here. The storytelling, scene by scene, are very entertaining. A pretty solid show for a Disney movie.

title: Terrific, fun movie!
text: One of the best movies I've seen since theaters reopened. A mix of King Solomon's Mines with Indiana Jones.Dwyane Johnson, Emily Blunt & Jack Whitehall have great chemistry and it shows onscreen. They look like they had fun making the movie.It is non-stop action with humor and poignancy, also.I love fun, adventure movies with supernatural elements, and this delivers.It is a magical, lovely, fun movie.

title: We've seen it before, but boy, does the formula works.
text: I didn't have an expectation towards the movie, not because I wasn't interested or aware of having Dwayne Johnson as the lead, due to him always having bald head and look almost like the same person in every films, simply because I want to enjoy it more, like the old times being a kid watching Disney movies.You may felt you've spent 2 hours on a formulaic Disney movie that you've seen it before. But I didn't complain about the aftertaste.The film is fast paced, funny, with a balanced chemistry between the casts and has an entertaining plot. Like I said, it's seems like we've seen it before, because the they are using similar formula with Pirates of the Carribean, with a little 1999 The Mummy, but in a good and successful way, the way they wished to do in Pirates movies after the third one, but failed miserably.I don't understand the bad reviews. The only thing that I noticed something off was the CGI, it seems like a lot of stuff needed to be, and should have, been retouched. The score and soundtrack also didn't leave a mark, it shoud have a memorable riff of music in intense scenes and the third act, like it did for Pirates movies. But this one was bland, to say the least.The rest was an enjoyable cruise.

title: Go back to storytelling
text: The Rock, Emily Blunt, Paul Giamatti and a CG cat could not save this Disney Cruise from sinking. Forcing a classic ride to be a movie without good writing was a recipe for disaster. The story sucks. Chemistry is lacking. Paul Giamatti's character was unduly minimized. Villains were lackluster. Go back to stories and don't worry about casting mega stars Disney.

title: A combination of Indiana Jones and pirates of the Carribbean
text: This is a very well done film and far better than I was expecting. It seemed to me like Indiana Jones meets pirates of the Caribbean but it really works.Jack Whitehall is excellent in His part, as were the rock and Emily blunt, and they make film. I also loved the in jokes from the ride.Really enjoyed it, Disney at is best.

title: Long, loud and boring
text: "Jungle Cruise" is a big time Disney dud. It's a long, often painful, watch. The cast is appealing but they seem to mailing it in. The script is ridiculous. The CGI is often unconvincing. The action is uninspired. I was a fan Dwayne Johnson's movies for a while, not anymore. Lately its been one bad movie from him after another. "Jungle Cruise" is a lazy piece of filmmaking.

title: Nothing new
text: This movie is not a complete disaster, but it uses a well-known formula.The story is very convenient for the protagonists, it is predictable and sometimes incongruous. Character development lacks and falls into many places known as romance. The special effects are convincing but, the CGI not so much, the editing makes the film very tedious, ruining the experience, the characters do not feel with a thought of the time where the story takes place, the performances are not very remarkable, except for Emily Blunt, who makes the movie more enjoyable.It's a predictable, convenient movie, and it doesn't innovate with a different story.

title: Great movie
text: Awesome fun. Great characters and acting thoroughly enjoyable. The Rock and Emma Blunt are great together.

title: Nothing special
text: Basic Disney adventure family movie along the lines of raider of the Lost ark, race to witch mountain etc...it's ok keep the kids entertained but u only watch it once..

title: Entertaining Adventure Film for the Whole Family
text: Colour me surprised! For years, movies have been inspired by witty scripts, intriguing novels or even great video games but this is the first time I know of that a film has been inspired by a riverboat amusement ride. While the idea might sound puzzling on paper, the final result is actually a decent adventure film for the entire family.Jungle Cruise manages to work for different reasons. First of all, the locations look absolutely astonishing. It's obvious that most of these locations have been produced in a studio but instead of looking fake, they transmit a magical atmosphere recalling fantasy milestones such as Avatar. The special effects in this film would even deserve an Academy Award.Up next, the story is simple but comes around with a few interesting twists and turns, involving the son of a German emperor, a mysterious indigenous tribe and a horde of undead conquistadores. These elements make the film entertaining from start to finish and provide a pace that will even keep viewers intrigued who have a short attention span.The acting performances are decent and quite sympathetic as well. Emily Blunt for instance shines as independent, resilient and strong woman who knows exactly what she wants and is willing to take enormous risks to make her ambitions come true. Her brother is played by Jack Whitehall who seems a little bit arrogant, naive and fearful at the beginning but who ends up becoming more complex and profound as he turns out to be courageous, loyal and supportive. Jesse Plemons finds an excellent balance between danger and satire when incarnating the son of a German emperor with megalomaniac eccentricities. Every single actress and actor does a very convincing job and manages to make a good movie great.Jungle Cruise is an interesting adventure film for the entire family. The movie is intense but not brutal. The story is creative but not too complex. The length is neither too short nor too long. It's the kind of movie that could equally please a grand-father who fondly remembers the Indiana Jones movies, a young mother who has grown up playing Tomb Raider video games and a young daughter who admires acting super star Dwayne Johnson. It might not be the most experimental, groundbreaking or intellectual movie but it offers two hours of welcome escapism to the whole family.

title: 😍😍 I absolutely loved it
text: Jungle Cruise was absolutely splendid. I love the animals, the adventure, the beautiful love story, and London. It's a film fit for the whole family to see.

title: Fell asleep
text: This was a bad ripoff of Indiana Jones. Terrible acting, the script was probably slapped togheter in a week, zero chemistry between Emily and Dwane, the action scenes were too much with no breathing room, you can't even understand what is going on. And of course Disney threw in the usual PC crap into the mix to make it even worse. A nazi villan with uniform and medals and an U-boat...I think we beat that horse enough. Sounds like a 5 year old came up with the plot. The visual effects and the Metallica sound track was the only positive about this movie.

title: Tries to copy too many other successful movies
text: Wow, I am not sure why other IMDb users are giving this movie such a high score but it is not enjoyable and not worth your time. I just watched on Disney+It takes elements from other (much better movies) such as Indiana Jones, the Mummy, Pirates of the Caribbean and tries to blend them together but unsuccessfully.The action is not exciting, the heroes never seem to be in any real danger, the bad guys are so stereotypical and the CGI is not very good. The movie is also way too long.Don't bother. It's not worth it.

title: AWESOME movie!
text: The movie kept me entertained throughout. This movie will make you laugh and keep you on the edge of your seat almost throughout.A must watch for kids and adults!

title: Killers of the flower moon
text:
* The film had a rocky start; the first 15 minutes weren't precisely ludicrous but were non-engaging for me as an audience
* The characters look so stupid throughout the film, Like Lily Houghton(Emily Blunt) getting duped by Frank(Rock)
* The gimmicks pulled off by Frank are so lame that any sane person would see through them, but our Lily couldn't(Oi, someone tell her!)
* Though, it was supposed to be an adventure movie. It never gave that adrenaline rush or a thrill that you would generally get from watching such movies, e.g., Jumanji movies
* The lack of sense of thrill could be attributed to its generic and predictable screenplay
* It felt that Characters meet because the script demands them to do so, rather than creating a compelling scenario for them to meet
* It's like ", Yeah, we need a hero, a heroine and a sidekick for the adventure."
* Generally, adventure movies have a wafer-thin plot. This film is no such exception to that
* To that, add lack of proper execution. I never really felt the motivation of the characters to undertake such a hazardous mission which is a classic case of faulty execution
* Jesse Plemons was a generic bad guy with a terrible and forced accent(dew it!), Jack Whitehall tried his best to make me laugh but all in vain
* The visuals were striking enough, though, not 200 million worth striking enough but striking enough nevertheless
* Emily Blunt is the star of the show, though her character was poorly written. She brought out her earnest self. Well, Rock is just himself in all movies
* There were scattered attempts at horror, but in the face of poor writing and clunky dialogue. It felt like a squandered opportunity
* The twist in the middle was a decent one and intriguing
* The ending was generic and predictable(Cmon, What did you expect?). I thought they would go the unexpected route, but no!* Overall, Jungle Cruise is partly entertaining but let down by poor writing and shoddy execution
Beta-Pros
* Emily Blunt
* Twist
* CinematographyBeta-Cons
* Plot
* Writing
* Execution
* Predictable
* EndingBeta-Thoughts: DisappointingBeta-Meter: 4.5/10Beta-Punchline: Killers of the Flower Moon.

title: Fun ride!
text: There's humor, there's darkness, there are surprises, there's cheesiness, there's a lot of fun in this movie. The soundtrack was fun, too, and overall the movie does a great job of capturing the fun of the Disneyland ride while adding an interesting story. Macgregor was a great character, and I want to see more from Jack Whitehall. The casting was great all around.

title: Visually annoying
text: The chemistry between the protagonists is what kept me going until the end. As did the humor, including the dad jokes.As for the rest, the movie feels completely artificial. Visually it is just pure CGI, unnatural HDR lighting and colors. While you could argue that this is completely intentional, there's clearly a trend in this direction and unfortunately it's such an annoyance to me that I just can't enjoy the movie at allKudos to the actors though that can pull it off to make a full movie just on the green screen and still transport emotions.

title: Worth to watch
text: The casting acting was amazing there's suspense comedy action if you looking a nice movie with family friends I think this one is worth it.

title: Disappointing
text: I had high hopes for this movie but found myself disappointed by the end.It's similar in ways to Indiana Jones and Pirates of the Caribbean but is far below the quality of these movies.The characters aren't loveable enough for such a long movie. The two main characters kept bickering throughout the movie but not in an endearing way. The obsession with pants also got tedious very quickly.Two thirds of the way through i was getting bored. The cgi was way too obvious and overused. The plot was getting nowhere fast but included all the modern messaging that Disney encodes in their mo ies these days. And at over two hours it was getting a bit frustrating.I'd advise people to watch the first Pirates of the Caribbean movie or the original Indiana Jones movies before this.

title: two hours of fun
text: I enjoyed it very much in this time of sadness and despair.

title: I give it a 5.4
text: If you want to watch an adventure then watch this. It's a mix of national treasure, pirates of the Caribbean and classic Disney. It was not horrible but i will not watch it any time soon with my kids once is enough for at least the next 2 months... If that helps.

title: Disney fun with Dwayne
text:
Suspend reality and have some fun. More Indy Jones / the Mummy than Captain Jack.Love the disney ride bad jokes and love the movie had them too.Good chemistry between Dwayne and Emily.Surprised by Jack Whitehall..a touch of John Hannah from the Mummy
Some people should learn to relax and just enjoy a movie.

title: At least it wasn't boring
text: The usual The Rock- stuff, meaning solid action and an acceptable storyline. But the special effects and CGI, poor, very poor.

title: A love story
text: Now this movie had a lot of twists and turns and it was the best I mean it also had some funny part it looked like a mixture of comedy romance adventure etc the movie was that good I like Dwayne Johnson what a great actor he is. And also the people of the jungle looked really great and what a beautiful jungle I've always wanted to go to a jungle. I mean it's beautiful but I can't go because it's tropical weather in south America. But anyway big thumbs up wouldn't it be great if they made a second film. Oh and this movie reminded me about me one day going on an adventure.but not somewhere where it's tropical weather.

title: Not Disney's finest
text: With the cast and the premise this film could have been a family laugh riot but it just misses the mark. The film tries to be National Treasure, Pirattes of the Caribbean and The Mummy rolled into one.......there in lies the films problem it has no identity of its own.Dwayne Johnson is perfectly cast as the skipper and u have to think after the super serious roles of A Quiet Place 1 & 2 Emily Blunt just wanted to do something a lot more light hearted and fun. But she brings some heavy weight credibility to this film and the chemistry between her and The Rock is right there up on the screen.The action sequences are good, the cgi not bad and keeps the film ticking along, but do feel in older films like Pirates and even The Mummy the action sequences are better and more exciting. Overall its a decent, fun, family film that you'll enjoy but probably forget as soon as you've seen it.

title: Yep
text: Watch it and relax.Giving a 10 to boost it up its ranking cause is a very cool,chill and easy movie to watch.Good job to the director and to the actors.

title: Average movie
text:
When I was watching this movie I thought this is going well but very average story in this movie
But in this movie CGI and VFX part is awesome and good jokes are good no complaint but remember this is average.

title: Another Great Movie From the Rock
text: I really liked how chill and non-serious this film was. The Rock plays his role very well, there's tons of supernatural elements and "magic", curses and undead people, and the plot is just straight forward and simple. The Amazon is on full display, with tribes and forgotten people. And the adventure is just worth the ride.But if you want a serious film that has real substance, look elsewhere. This one is definitely more on the fantasy end, as any Disney movie. It expects you to imagine and play along as they tell their very casual (and not very convoluted) story.

title: You'll get what you expect, but maybe you want that?
text: Almost no surprises here, but sometimes that's just what you want? This is a movie when you're hung over and don't want to do much of anything. It is not, however, a good movie but it fulfills it's purpose.

title: Indiana Jones meets Pirates of the Caribbean.
text: Loved it, great for the whole family. It's intentionally over the top, which is what makes it so fun. I have to admit it's pretty cheesy, it rewatch the Indiana Jones movies and tell me their not equally cheesy.

title: Indiana Jones did it better
text: Filled in a rainy afternoon but that's it. Was expecting something better. The jokes and puns were flat and a bit grating after the first few. Dig out the old Indiana Jones movies....much better.

title: Pirates of the Amazon
text: Didn't think it was possible but Disney literally ripped off its own series. This movie started out as the actual jungle cruise and very quickly turned to Bootstrap Bill and cursed gold coins and tribal indians turning Jack into a fruit kabob. Change the Caribbean to Brazil and switch the pet from a monkey to a jaguar and you've got yourself a brand new family adventure film. An adequately entertaining movie over all, but lacking the chemistry that Kierra Knightley and Orlando Bloom brought to the whole franchise. Disney's scraping the bottom of the barrel... what's next, rename Lightning McQueen and call it Autopia?

title: It Entertained Me
text:
Yes. It's a silly movie, but I love the Rock, (despite his over saturation, he still "smolders"). 😉
I love Emily Blunt even more (my current smart, funny, strong, sexy dream girl😆), therefore I have no choice but to love this movie. And it does have references to the Disney ride that was one of my favorites too. So there. If you don't like it? I understand, but I don't care.

title: Jumanji on Water - But Bad
text: I was actually excited about watching this movie. Whoever put together the trailer did a great job of making this movie look entertaining however, it is not. It feels like Jumanji on water put far less enjoyable. It was just another overhyped disney movie and that is disappointing because I really wanted to like it.

title: Great Fun! Emily Blunt is amazing!
text: Fun film doesn't take itself too seriously. The film is so colourful and has lots of vibrant jungle colours. Bit of Pirates of Caribbean vibe thrown in which I thought made the second half of the film a bit more exciting.Emily Blunt plays the protoganist role really well, I like the angle of her being a empowered women who doesn't let the male prejudices of the time period get in her way of what she wants to do; 'the women with pants'.She also looks beautifull in this and some scenes when they are on the boat are mesmerising. I wish she featured in more films as she is a an amazing actress.

title: Unendurable
text: This really was more than I could bear. I found that the movie was not enjoyable at all. Emily Blunt is a fine actress, and I have previously enjoyed her skills on the screen. Dwayne Johnson is quite expert at playing himself. Undoubtedly then their skills should have been sufficient for the task. However, the overall package failed to deliver. Jack was probably trying to play himself as well, but delivered an insipid and uninspiring performance in his role.The movie attempts to cobble together the best bits of Indiana Jones and Pirates of the Caribbean with a touch of The Mummy. This is somewhat like building one aircraft out of spare parts from several other brands and styles. The result just won't fly.In the final wash-up I found myself wandering away to find something more interesting to do.

title: Could have been edited better !
text: I like action adventure movie even if the story is the same old same old with new characters. The issue I found was the editing. Felt like the whole movie was shot in 2 seconds cuts and all in closeups to the face when the characters talked to each other. Was any part at all shot in a jungle as it looked like they CGI everything.Dwayne Johnson was also not very good in this. Looked little off in terms of energy or style. Can't put a finger on what. Good movie to watch but could have been much better.

title: Great film
text: Fun family film. But ridiculous but great fun. Adventure and laughter. CGI a bit over the top at times.The film at over 2 hours is slightly long but never gets boring.

title: Had potential but annoying characters and a familiar plot stand in the way
text: The overall idea of this movie seems good. An out of his luck boat ride skipper is taking a woman bent on finding a mystical place in order to fulfill her father's dream.On a positive note to mention is the production value, the nice cinematography and a mostly capable direction. Emily Blunt and Dwayne Johnson also have nice chemistry.However, what's not working is for instance the story flow and how the arc is structured.The movie has almost progressed two thirds of its run time until the gist of everything comes to fruition to actually start off the meaningful plot. The villains are quite one-dimensional, even if one of them gets a half-baked backstory. And please for the love of god cast someone from the actual country if that character is supposed to be from there. Jesse Plemons is a capable actor but the German accent was as fake as imaginable. Same goes for Paul Giamatti.Another bothersome aspect are the character interactions that don't make sense or are only there for cliché points. For instance the comic relief brother is almost the exact same character as in the 1999 The Mummy. Moreover, there's tons of familiarities with primarily two movies, them being Pirates of the Caribbean and the aforementioned The Mummy. It would've served the story well to continue the story built up in the beginning instead of chipping in parts from other movies.Last but not least there's a surprise reveal in the movie that makes barely any sense considering the actions and behavior of that character before. It would've sufficed without and due to the many writing issues of that character the ending was unearned and barely believable.Summing up, this movie had potential but in the end it suffered from wanting to be something that used to be popular and in the meantime something on its own, as well making the end product a convoluted mess. However, it's alright for a Sunday afternoon.

title: Fun movie to watch
text: This is fun movie to watch with the whole family. You get a great laugh and get in on the adventure and action. Sooo many dad jokes in it and a fun storyline. Loved it!!

title: Made me smile
text: Just loved it - this movie made me smile. What more can you expect from a Disney/Hollywood movie? You will have a great time and feel young - and dream - again. This is what good Hollywood cinema has always been about.Worth every second of your time. And also worth every cent you spend on it. It's a great, worry-free time for you.As for the actory, Dwane and Emily have great chemistry - even though they probalby shoudln'nt - and it's just pure childish fun to see them at their best.Yes, some of the CGI could have been better, especially the animated wild cat. But still. If you can look past that, there's a great time to be had here. It might not be as great as PIRATES OF THE CARIBBEAN, but it sure is the next best thing.

title: A Missed Opportunity for Disney Magic
text: Despite its Disney branding, Jungle Cruise disappoints with lackluster animation, underdeveloped plot, and average performances. The film feels more like a formulaic cash grab than a genuine creative effort, missing the chance for a captivating adventure. From visuals to storytelling, it falls short, leaving viewers yearning for more excitement and depth. In an era of high standards, Jungle Cruise settles for mediocrity, failing to stand out. Weak screenplay and shallow character development further hinder engagement. In summary, Jungle Cruise fails to reach its potential, delivering a forgettable Disney experience instead of an enthralling, high-quality adventure.

title: Loved this movie from start to finish!
text: Enjoyed this movie from start to finish and so did my husband. So entertaining to watch, heaps of funny moments but gripping action scenes as well. Beautiful to watch. Loved the casting. Highly recommend this movie!

title: Hmm better I guess..
text: Main question, Why Rock signed for this movie. I felt the entire movie as a cringe stuff. Yea one fantasy tale to movie. Then the VFX is nice. I vote this movie for average (honestly I'm saying I'm not a hater of crew/actors/director).

title: It's the little things...
text: Live a little. Is it perfect no, but it's fun. Have so many forgot what that's like? Enjoy the moments, laugh a little. That's more than most movies can do now a days. I was skeptical at first, but if you give it a chance...you won't regret it. Live just a little:)

title: Enjoyable enough, but sure was dumb
text: Enjoyable enough run of the mill Dwayne Johnson adventure movie.Plotholes everywhere, dialog is a pain. Cinnematography and special effekts where good.

title: The best Disney movie with "real cast" ever!
text: I would give a 10 to this amazing film because of the cast, and I'm a big fan of Dwayne Johnson, and his performance in this movie is absolutely perfect, with Emily Blunt too (but I never saw her in a movie, this is the first time). And I laughed a lot of Dwayne Johnson, he is really funny. Also the photography is amazing.

title: Disappointing
text: After about 10 minutes it became too Indiana Jones then touches of many other adventure movies, which turned me off from enjoying a good cast of actors performing.

title: Disney has lost the plot!
text: Disney is just becoming more and more insufferable with every movie they make and this Is not different.The so called attempt at comedy was simply not funny and don't even get me started on the choice of actors and the acting itself.Its just plain stupid.

title: surprised,better than expected
text: I did not expect this is such a entertaining movie.the story is complex enought but not being to much pre-setup.the roles are standing out,eveyone is funny,realistic,has his own uniqueness to be remembered.i want to mention the characters relations building.it is really good and real.better than most of the commercial movies.Recommended for a family movie night.

title: Brief end-to-end Jungle Cruise: Review [Rating: 5 out of 10]
text: Simply this movie is just awful. The story does not have any harmony and holding power. After a few minutes later, the film seems like a headache.[Suggestion: do not watch this movie if you have valuable time, it will be swallow 2 hours from your life.]

title: A classic adventure with Dwayne Johnson
text: Adapted from another Disneyland attraction, Jungle Cruise is an entertaining and enjoyable adventure story. It has a good cast highlighting Dwayne Johnson in the lead role. He plays quite a charismatic character with a very interesting story. The concept of the film about the search for a plant with healing powers is not very original and the adventure of this film becomes cliché. Still, it's a classic adventure story that's well-crafted with a decent script, very good production, great soundtrack, and good action scenes. It is a classic adventure story to have a great time. My rating for this movie is 9/10.

title: I liked it better when...
text: I liked the better when I watched the first time. This movie reminded me of the mummy and pirates of the caribbean. Same Disney story, looking for treasure, cursed gold, cursed people and a unbelievable love story with a lot of annoying banter.

title: High Adventure
text: I saw "Jungle Cruise", starring Dwayne Johnson-Ballers_tv, Baywatch_2017; Emily Blunt-the Quiet Place movies, The Wolfman_2010; Edgar Ramirez-Point Break_2015, The Bourne Ultimatum and Jesse Plemons-Judas and the Black Messiah, Battleship.In case you haven't heard-and I don't see how you haven't, but-this movie is based on the Disneyland amusement park ride. On the ride, a skipper takes a group of people through the jungle on a boat ride that is surrounded by wild animals and nasty natives. And all the time, the skipper tells bad jokes or puns-some are so bad they are good. And just because it's a Disney movie doesn't mean it is suitable for little kids, because it's not-it's rated 'PG-13'. There are some scenes that might frighten little ones, as well as some of the bigger ones, too-my wife was squeezing my arm on several occasions. Dwayne plays the skipper that is hired by Emily-a sort of Indiana Jane-to be a guide to take her down the river in pursuit of a magical flower that grows only in a certain area of the Amazon. Edgar plays a conquistador that failed in his quest 400 years earlier to find the flower and Jesse plays a Nazi trying to find the flower to help Germany win the war-this story takes place around 1917. The effects are good and the story has a nice twist near the end and if you are a Metallica fan-like me-you will hear a new version of 'Nothing Else Matters'.It's rated "PG-13" for adventure violence and has a running time of 2 hours & 7 minutes.

title: Amazing!
text: This is one of the best movies I've ever seen! And my favorite Dwayne Johnson film so far. The acting was perfection. The plot was perfection. Everything was perfection. I recommend it for everyone to check it out.

title: Incredibly boring
text: It's funny how a film can be brand new and yet feel so old already. It's like oz the great and powerful and the Tim burton Alice in wonderland film... boring, CGI packed with little substance. It has a generic female who just throws around cliche feminist statements, "yes I'm a woman who wears trousers." The rock makes no sense in this and feels so out of place. Jack Whitehall's acting is awkward and very forgettable. There's just nothing good about this.

title: Fun to watch
text: I loved it it. It reminded me of the first The Mummy film. Great cast and storyline.

title: Great concept and sets up the story well. Great chemistry between leads. Ultimately falls flat after the first act.
text: I think 6.6 is an appropriate score. I give it a 6 because I can't vote in decimals. It is not a 7. The concept is great and the setting and events enjoyable to watch. It's like Indiana Jones meets the Jungle Book type vibe. However the journey is a bit lacklustre. The plot falls apart after the first hour and I can't remember what happens logically and I only saw it a few weeks ago. DJ and Emily Blunt have good chemistry though and are always a pleasure to watch. Jack Whitehall is just a pleb and not a very funny one. Kids might see past some of the flaws and consider it slightly more favourably. I doubt even the kids would give it top marks though.

title: Experience
text:
When I see Indiana Jones, The Mummy, Harry Potter,
The Hobbit, The lord of the rings, pirates of the Caribbean, I really enjoy this type of movie and series...
It's feel heaven.

title: I say this from a place of love.
text: It wasn't good. The acting was excellent but it wasn't enough to carry the thin plot and poor script.I wasn't expecting excellent. I was expecting a dieselpunk Pirates of the Caribbean. A little mystery, a little romance, some witty repartee, a hummable soundtrack, and action sequences to boost the run time from 1:20 to 1:45.The soundtrack was meh, the mystery and romance were there in reasonable amounts.As for the script I liked the callouts to the African Queen, The repartee was mostly there but some scenes felt out of order and just cobbled on. A dead squirrel to summon piranha in the water he just told her to swim in.A lot of the action didn't make sense. If they are going up the river, why do they go down the rapids?I enjoyed it but probably won't watch it again. It could have been great,

title: Action adventures for families
text: It's a good action and adventure family film that is quintessential Disney. The Rock keeps the mood lively with his many jokes and puns. The production value such as the sets, CGI, wardrobe and the cinematography are top notch; exactly what I would expect from a Disney production. The Rock and Emily Blunt have good on screen chemistry. The pace of the film is fast with quick witty dialog lines and swashbuckling action scenes from both co-stars. The directing is superb. The entire flow of this film is as smooth as soft creamy sweet butter.However, as much as I liked this film, I couldn't help comparing and contrasting this modern day film aesthetics with the older classic "The African Queen" (1951) with Katharine Hepburn and Humphrey Bogart. It made me think how a remake of The African Queen might have look like today, without the Disneyfication in the script. I think the Rock could have pulled off Bogart's character.

title: Fun!!!
text: Omgsh so good an so funny!! Absolutely loved it!! Love the actors/actress in it :))) must watch!!!!

title: Cut and pasted Disney movies
text: It's all concepts and plots from many different Disney movies. Do you like Tangled?, there's a magic plant, do you like POTC?, because there's cursed characters and evil Spaniards. Do you like Jumanji?, because there's jungle scenes galore. Do you like Indiana Jones?, there's Temples and evil Germans. It's really poorly put together, along with bad CGI backgrounds, bad/predictable plot, and terrible accents.

title: A delightful ride
text: This movie made me feel joy. It felt like movies that don't get made very much anymore. Just whimsical, fantasy adventure movies with some cheesy choreographed fight scenes that landed just right. It made me think Indiana Jones meets Pirates of the Caribbean with its own flare.The cast was excellent. All three main characters played by Emily Blunt, Dwyane Johnson, and Jack Whitehall were fantastic fun and had great chemistry. The actors played their parts well and I had a really fun time watching them and this film.

title: Film that 'clicks'
text: I think this film is better than Pirates of the Caribbean.

title: Poor kiddie fare.
text: Once upon a time children were offered exciting, funny, original movies that they could revisit as adults and enjoy again with their own kids. This clichèd, PC, CGI infested offering from Disney is served up to ensure that one viewing is more than enough. Every actor in it (even the leopard) is required to overact which I guess is trying to add humour even where there is none. Also much of the talky banter between Skippy & Pants is boring. Fortunately I'm watching this cheaply from Disney+ but wondering if I'll make it to the end.

title: Seriously????
text: Come on! What the F*!!!? The editing was bad and clumsy. The cast did what they got paid for. The jokes were ... well ... horrible and the special effects were ok but not more.I wanted to enjoy this film. I expected an Indy/Pirates mash up, but all i got was this lousy waste of time.

title: Jungle cruise
text: If you like the pirates of the Caribbean movies you'll love jungle Cruise.

title: Shamelss rip off, and too many edits
text: The concept is a mashup of 'Atlantis: The Lost Empire' and 'Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle', The former being a Disney animation, the latter an excellent reimagining by Columbia (Sony) of the old Jumanji movie.So we get very poor action sequences that don't fit the characters. The plot is wafer thin, and padded with so much pointless action it is exhausting. The use 7 cuts minimum to convey a simple scene, sometimes more than 20. It is horrid, like how Wes Anderson does his films now.The jokes do not land, at all. The writing is very poor and they can't make any of the material work. The pacing is rapid fire and the scenes that should be held on to are sped up.The visuals are the worst part of the entire piece, the background looks like poor quality CGI with the characters and foreground stuck on in the cheapest way possible; the same issue they had with 'The Witches'. The Colours and illumination never match up. Neither do the camera angles. Everything is nauseating and ugly. I haven't felt this nauseated since 'Cats' from 2019.Disney sank lower than last year's awful and disgraceful 'Mulan' movie remake. And that says a lot because I hated how that turned out, as did anyone with a functioning brain.Disney has absolutely no idea anymore how to make a movie, let alone write a script; they even lost the technical competency to produce or direct a movie any more. They seem to not know how to do the basic tasks to produce a sequence of scenes that don't look like a disjointed mess.2/10 the worst film I've seen this year, and one of the worst pieces of crap I have ever watched (I gave Mulan last year a 3/10 for much the same issues and they somehow made a worse film.)

title: Suprisingly good.
text: Now this movie isn't bad at all; it is a fun, good family movie! I have got to be honest though, The Rock just plays the same character as his does always. Emily Blunt is very good in this and Jack Whitehall plays a great side character. The pacing is unexpected, it was very well paced! This is a good Disney movie for the family.

title: Tiresome
text: Oh look, another one of those movies.Germans bad, Spanish bad, British imperialist good.

title: A Disney attraction coming to life
text: A well known and very much beloved attraction of the Disney theme parks finally gets an adventurous story to watch on the big screen. Traveling in time and exciting places, this story is set in 1916 where pants for women for still an issue and traveling to far and unknown places was part of some treasure hunt.Lily (portrayed by Emily Blunt) is the inspirational main character, driven by determination to solve the mystery about an ancient tree which holds the power of healing. She finds her challenge not only in the adventurous journey down the river but also in the fearless skipper Frank (Dwayne Johnson), and their witty rivalry becomes more and more intriguing and entertaining over time.Well set villain Prince Joachim (Jesse Plemons) with his German accent and his submarine make the hunt through the Amazonas river even more fun to watch. Recommended for every Disney enthusiast and everyone who likes some fun adventure stories.

title: Nothing special.
text: The movie starts well but... It turns out to be incredibly long and average. Special effects are below the standard of what Disney as made us used too.

title: Really loved it! Lots of adventure - NEVER BORED!!
text: I love this movie! When Frank led the adventure cruise tour in the beginning, I laughed so hard because I thought I was at Disneyland! I'm a Disney geek and can't tell you how many times I've ridden the Jungle Cruise ride. It made that experience as fresh as my first ride!! So many of the same jokes and gags from the ride. I can imagine how freaky it would be to ride this on the actual Amazon!!I had a very stressful week this week, and this totally distracted me made me laugh and left me feeling in a great mood! Great movie!!

title: Woke Disney
text: Disney writers are why we can't have nice things. Woke in every way. Weak script, wooden dialogue, cardboard cutout characters with wokeness galore. Pass.

title: Great Wholesome Fun for everyone above 10 years old including the adult inner child
text:
This was a delight from start to finish , unusual for Disney,very fast moving scenarios,and location changes,
the funnies that the main characters delivered were amusing but not in a cringeworthy way.Late 19th Century setting into the early 20th century ,slightly anachronistic but for comedic effect
and of course all the social cliches of that period.Great scenarios for the Amazon delta and some improvised potted history of the early Spanish invaders of the Continent.Had a slight Pirates of the Caribbean flavour to it but not as frenetic.It seems that Emily Blunt ,Dwayne Johnson mixed with Jack Whitehorn's quick fire off the cuff style was a comedy marriage for the trio,
definitely a classic for this 21st century for revisiting.

title: Anacondas 2 meets Pirates of the Caribbean
text: The movie feels like gentrification, they picked an existing plot and added fancy CGI, solid casting, and other premium Disney bits. Despite that, I enjoyed it. Emily Blunt (Lily Houghton aka Pants) and Dwayne Johnson (Frank aka Skippy) had undeniable chemistry. The movie was light-hearted, fun, and worth 2 hours of a lazy day. I hold one entire star back because the plot has too many goofs and while they've used a repetitive storyline, justice was not done.The movie could have been much better, it did have a scope, but well, they had their chance.

title: Not that great for kids
text: The movie was fairly violent with gross things crawling in, out, through, over people. Yes - kids LOVE that sort of thing. Doesn't mean they get to watch it, especially the little ones. (PG-13 should mean 13 years old, not 4.) It was typical Disney Pirates of the Caribbean 9 - none of the charm but all of the CGI. It was just relentless noise after noise.

title: So much fun!
text: I was expecting this movie to be lame. Maybe feeling that way going in made it more enjoyable, but regardless, I absolutely loved it. It was just the right amount of corniness, Disney-ness, action and fun I needed to truly love this movie. It's very difficult to find something negative about a movie that went above my expectations.

title: The movie was too dark
text: I couldn't make out what was happening most of the time. It was awful when they used special effect like when the prince discovered something in the rocks & he talks to a snake & bees came out. There were men who had been turned into creatures stuck in the rocks & a main creature that I never did get to see because it was too dark. Most of the movie takes place in the dark jungle under the moon, underwater & in dark caves so you can't tell what's going on. I turned my brightness settings all the way up & it didn't help. They do this in horror movies a lot but not in a movie like this. Of course if you can't see the movie because it's too dark it will ruined the whole experience.

title: Funny Puns and Family Fun
text: Took my kids and while some references are probably lost on them even if they have ridden the ride dozens of times after ten years worth of trips to Disneyworld, the older folks (call them adults) found it entertaining. Nice mix of action and surprises, good family fun instead of the kids staring into their little screens.

title: Too much of BLACK LEGEND
text: Entertaining movie. The Rock is great as usual. The problem is the continue feeding of Black Legend against Spain and the Conquistadors. Absolutely inaccurate. England wasn't as developed and clean at the time nor Spain so dark. So tired of Disney and it's continuity of the Black Legend against Spain and our legacy. Here the Briefing are the "good guys" as usual...well tell that to the natives of the north or elsewhere under the British or it's pirates. Come on Disney!!! Enough is enough!!!

title: Good movie
text: This is one of the few movie made in 2021 that actually is nice to watch.The acting is good with nice actions. Once the movie starts it's a nice ride down the river. Maybe the CGI is some scene a bit unnecessary and some fight and action scenes could do with a few less cuts.To me it feels much more like a bit more scary Jumanji than Indiana Jones, but entertaining nevertheless...enjoy :-)

title: Even Dwayne Johnson could not fix this nonsense.
text: I have several questions:1 What?2 Why?3 Who bought youre lights.Azefdrhxgjf4uvr6u fujfybbytttgfffhjgcigkjero6 kggjfeytezfvhy6rfd jghj. Ygnvgujfethvrgcrr bvfj. (For the 150 characters)

title: Great Entertainment for Disney Fans
text: Fantastic movie! The "subtle" reference to Disney's ride was brilliant. Thoroughly enjoyed every moment of this movie! It has great humour, casting and enough action to hook in the kids and adults alike. This has become a new family favourite.

title: Poorly Written
text: It's a poorly written story. They just stretched what you get from the ride into a feature length film. The producers probably spent their budget on the Rock and Emily Blunt. They couldn't afford a good script after that.At least Pirates added more to the story. Here they just give you some lazy slop. Not worth watching. 👎🏼

title: AMAZING, Humorous, Family Friendly ACTION
text: Beautiful movie with amazing cast of characters and suspenseful plot! The scenery was flawless and very heartfelt also. Love it!It's just also so difficult to watch people strive so hard to find such a tree of life that heals and breaks curses....They were willing to kill, steal, betray and give up their lives...But the tree of life opens His arms to us all! His name is Jesus Christ. He heals, broke the curse for us all and anyone can go to Him if they seek Him with all their heart.

title: 80's movie?
text: A very common storyline, there is nothing creative about this movie. The ending was very common. If this movie was released in the 80's I would have gave it 7 stars. Only positive is Emily's performance, her character's will was wonderfully covered & kept the audience to their seat.

title: Fun ride
text: Really enjoyed this one. Like the mummy meets jumangi.

title: Disney, you did better movie than this (POC)
text: It did not meet the expectations. I saw the interview with the casts, Emily said day after tomorrow was better or she was kinda trying to say it was beter and she couldn't. It's true.

title: A Karen in the Jungle
text: This film is about an English lady interfering in the amazon people's lives, lecturing them on how to live.Obviously, it's an entertaining film, in the same category as Pirates of the Caribbean or Jumanji, but the main character is definitely not captivating. Dwayne Johnson plays basically the same type of character he's become known for and that's okay, but his obsession with her pants is beyond annoying, like trying to remind us all the time that women were not allowed to wear pants 100 years ago.Now once and for all, in Brazil people speak PORTUGUESE and not Spanish! Anyone can discover that with 2 seconds on Google, except for movie producers.

title: Great chemistry!
text: I truly hope these actors work together again on another project. Ms. Blunt and Mr. Johnson have fantastic and mgical "chemistry" together!I didn't think I'd like this movie, but ended up loving it!

title: Could have been better.
text: This movie has some really strong scenes and funny parts. They used far too much CGI and it's frustrating showing a family movie to my family when Disney decides to throw in a gay guy. You can never have a movie anymore without throwing in PC garbage.

title: Great movie in this specific genre
text: Great movie in this specific genre! Great actors play, sometimes dramatic, comedic and funny, sensitive movie! And very kind!

title: The Mummy on cruise control.
text: The latest Disneyland attraction to get the Hollywood treatment.If you liked The Mummy (1999), chances are you'll like this, because structurally it's the same movie. Even the characters are identical; our educated independent English woman lead on a quest, her flamboyant self involved comedic relief brother, The Morally ambiguous scruffy handsome hero, the conniving swindling funny little businessman, and an undead cursed enforcer hell bent on completing a ritual.Farcical humor, high def action editing in ADHD, and a story that barrels through nonstop - until we slow right down in the 3rd act.Less Jungle Cruising and more River boating of the Caribbean.

title: Better than expected
text: So I had no idea what this movie was even about but I put it on and it exceeded my expectations by like 100%. I thought it was going to be a silly movie but it was actually very entertaining.

title: time to loose
text: Nothing special. No chemistry between the characters.

title: Fun boat ride!
text: Fun boat ride adventure, good acting and scenery/effects, best character: Proxima the jaguar! 8/10.

title: Randomish Cruise
text: Classic adventure in search of a random treasure with funny jokes thanks to The Rock and a feminist protagonist. The more you watch the more enemies and situations gets randomic and surreal. Messed up execution.

title: Cute Family Fun
text: Family-friendly in the same vein as early Pirates of the Caribbean or the Jumangi remake. It's fun- safe to watch with older kids (wouldn't recommend for < 7) and still gives all the love of the ride from Disney. Especially the dad jokes (which is what the boat driver on the ride does throughout the tour)!

title: A Couple of Hours Wasted Drifting on a Leaky Boat!
text: In the vanguard of Stephen Sommers's Mummy franchise and Disney's own Pirates of the Caribbean franchise, we are now gifted Jungle Cruise, directed by Jaume Collet-Serra and written by a cast of thousands (and it shows). It stars The Rock and Emily Blunt in another Disney production based on one of their many theme park rides, just like the above - mentioned Pirates of the Caribbean. And this in my opinion sums up the problems with this extremely expensive film. It is just way too, seen it all before, derivative.You want a wholesome, fun, family - friendly adventure with some non - threatening supernatural undertones and plenty of CGI imagery? This is it. In completely the same vein as it was in the above films and even earlier films such as the Indiana Jones quadrilogy. As such, it does feel like a cannibalised feature made up of spare parts from earlier, better quality products.So we have Dr Lily Houghton (Blunt) and her comically foppish brother (The Mummy) seeking a magical tree ( all of the above movies) and therefore requiring the knowledge, skills and abilities of experienced, Amazon River boat skipper Frank Wolff (The Rock) and his seen better days, river boat (The African Queen, Romancing the Stone and many others.). Inserted into the creaky, strung together, narrative are bad Germans (Indiana Jones), re - animated conquistadors (not pirates, as in POTC) and innumerable other jungle associated dangers.Dwayne Johnson and Emily Blunt have plenty of charm, if not a great deal of chemistry (The script never really allows it.). But much as I hate saying it about a $200 million dollar production, their star power wattage is no where near strong enough to overcome the crass, blatant phoniness of this project. Nothing at all seems realistic. It's just so obvious, so much of the movie was filmed in front of studio green screens and the content itself, is over - reliant on computer generated imagery.The pace is lightening quick, moving from one set action piece to another in the blink of an eye. But simultaneously uninvolving, because of the all too rapid - fire editing. The action scenes are cartoonish rather than exciting and largely a turn-off, because of a complete absence of suspense. There's a strong support cast, but talented actors such as Edgar Ramirez and Paul Giamatti are completely wasted in their under - written roles. It must be acknowledged that Jesse Plemons does have a lot of fun, overacting as the head villain of the piece.Jungle Cruise is glossy, escapist fare aimed it would seem at a tween audience and below. It could hardly be claimed to be adult entertainment, even at the best of times. As such, it is rather sad to say it's dull and inoffensive, rather than thrilling and riveting. I was frequently bored. I sincerely hope, no, pray, that this is the last of the Disney theme park ride films.

title: Needed a different director
text: I liked it, but it was too dark and tried to hard to be artistic. Which makes sense reading the directors filmography. It started out Disney, but lost the magic towards the middle. The sound was off, the Metallica music during the flashback was way-too-much...enjoyable but not a classic.

title: Really Enjoyable
text: Thoroughly enjoyed this film. Great fun with a great cast.

title: Great adventure movie
text: The film is pretty nice and slight for watching. We can see the connection with ,, Pirates of the Caribbean" and few other movies, which makes the movie even more interesting. The story which was told in the film is very original. Acting is on high level and it was other good role for Dwayne Johnson. The places which were chosen for filming also are just amazing. Definitely fans of the adventure ganre must give it a chance and to watch it.

title: Not too bad
text: Jungle Cruise was a good film but the only thing I liked about the film was Emily Blunt because she was my favourite in the film.Dwayne Johnson was good in the film.Emily Blunt was funnier because she had some humour in her and all the things she did in the film were really good.The main character I loved the most in the film was Emily's.Emily is a beautiful actress and the acting skills she has are amazing.She is a very good singer, actress, etc and I love her sense of style, beauty, fashion, etc.Emily Blunt is the one that stood out the most for me in the film.If I wanted to see an action film like this again please have Emily Blunt and Zachary Levi put together because they would be amazing together in an action movie and I would love to see that happen.

title: Big Fun
text: We really enjoyed this movie. Very good acting, very nice story and lovely scenery.We hope for a second Jungle Cruise!

title: A decent popcorn movie
text: A decent story to keep the family interested for about 2 hours. At times does feel a bit over the top. Some of the CGI appears rough as being a big budget movie you would expect more.

title: Excellent movie!
text: Excellent movie! I thought this was a fun and adventurous movie! It was definitely better than I expected. I wanted to see this on the big screen, but never got a chance to go out. It has an awesome cast of talented actors. Also, there were so many funny scenes AND a plot twist to say the least. All I can say without ruining the plot and saying too much, was that this is a great movie for the entire family. There is a lot of action from beginning to end, so you will not get bored. This is a movie I could definitely watch over abd over again. I don't know what else to add. I feel like if I say more, I will ruin the entire movie for those who haven't seen it yet.

title: Low budget, cliche and confused
text: The movie was probably done in a big artificial pool. I don't know. A lot of computer enhanced for otherwise a very small stage. Possibly most of the money went to the Rock that the movie itself is mediocre at most. Dialogue is smart and witty (some part), but a lot part of the story needs a good editing and cross check. Thee movie is also confused in describing itself as kid's movie, teen movie or? Many gruesome scenes. Emily Blunt is charming as always. It's also nice to see Jack W step up to a role in a big screen movie. The Rock is just himself. Self serving, and the he acts make you feel like why bother because he seems to think that everything will be ok for him... so yeah, why bother?

title: Exactly the movie it should be...
text: If you're gonna make a movie based on the famous Jungle Cruise Disney ride, you couldn't do better than this. No this isn't cinema for snooty people. But it pays homage to a great ride and does it in the way Disney does best. I don't understand the low scores on this one. This movie was so much fun. If you enjoyed my review, my name is Jesse, thanks for reading it. If you didn't enjoy it, my name is Kathleen Kennedy.

title: Disappointment
text: Even with a great cast of actors and actresses you still need a good story and directing. The poor directing can be illustrated by the fact that the out takes and deleted scenes are more entertaining than the movie. It should be a crime to take great stars like Dwayne Johnson, Emily Blunt and Paul Giamatti and make them drum down their acting ability and talent to fit a bad story.Johnson can deliver a well rounded and good performances in just about any project he takes on, so what is with the corny jokes? You tell me that this was funny? No! This was not FUNNY. Bad is an understatement. Get a good writer please!Blunt had better lines and scenes in the movie, but still the character was underdeveloped. There was a great deal of fact concerning the attitude of women in 1916 portrayed, but if you want to understand this better, I suggest you buy a good book and read the life story of Marie Curie. Do not waste your time watching movies that spin the facts and leave out all the important details.What really surprised me was how bad Paul Giamatti character was portrayed. When you look at the long list of his accomplished performances and what they presented in this film, you wonder what the director was going for here. If you want to see an outstanding example of Giamatti's s acting, watch his portrayal of King John in the movie Ironclad (2011). In the movie Morgan (2016) he plays Dr. Alan Shapiro in a short but powerful performance that works well with the plot and story. In Jungle Cruise his ability isn't allowed to develop the character, Nilo, at all. The character fails to convince and distracts more than supports the plot. His bird was more interesting then Nilo and they don't even mention the bird in the credits!

title: An absolute delight
text: Full of plot holes and unnecessary CGI, but an absolute delight!This was my first experience with Disney's Jungle Cruise, and also my first time back to a movie theater since the shutdown. We went with a friend who worked on the cruise in Anaheim for years, and I will say - she was less impressed.Perhaps it was the thrill of being out in a public setting like this for the first time in years, but I was giddy as a five year old the entire time. The silly puns, the jump scares - it was all a great time!

title: Visually appealing
text: Just your regular adventure movie, but minus a rich plot. In fact, it's linear and sort of peters out at that too.An initial museum scene was interesting, as also the magical blooming of the tree of life towards the end.I wouldn't suggest it to adults.

title: Wild Wild
text: I have awaited a while to see this movie because I wanted to read the and understand the plot to better my verdict. Emily blunt reminded of the lady Indiana Jones and combining that with The Rock's great sense of humor really brought this story to a whole new level. Thrilling and exited I was straight from the introduction; seeing how the director blended cgi technology with human innovation, creating this sensational cinematic brilliance. However I wish there was more explanation on the Amazonian, just to understand their origins, but they to were magnificent in the plot. If you'd like to experience the lady version of Indiana jones on high octane, this flick is it folks, after this you'll be begging for a sequel, from me ooh yes 2 thumbs up indeed.

title: Capital F for FUN!
text: I think this movie knows what's it is.. a Disney copycat movie on a mission to give the audience a thrill ride. I can say it delivers on that promise! It's fun, action packed and the best the rock has been for a while. Emily Blunt is also fantastic. Could I nitpick how cliche it is and how the CGI isn't great.. yes. Do I care to, no, no I don't because I had a awesome time watching this and one of the better movies of 2021.

title: Good Ride Doesn't Mean Good Film
text: So underwhelming in its opening periods that focus is lost easily and it's difficult to even make a judgement on the rest of the film. The Rock plays The Rock, the same as in every other film he's in, Blunt plays the ever-present posh English woman able to handle herself, and Whitehall plays the only character the US know how to cast him as. Everything is cliche and unoriginal, and evidently a good ride doesn't translate to a good film.Action is fairly immediate and frequent, but without substance or consequence. Even while zoning in and out of the film, you can tell the quality never truly improves as the adventure is non-stop.Visually very impressive to start with, then CGI galore, which isn't bad but not as aesthetic. Forgettable.

title: Tired of the bad comments
text: People are so judgmental anymore. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. Dewayne Johnson and Emily Blunt were amazing. As far as the jokes and humor go, I laughed throughout the movie. The relationship build between Skippy and Pants (aka Frank and Lily) was beautiful and hilarious to watch unfold. I definitely don't think it felt like a "theme park ride". I wish people would just sit back and enjoy a movie and take the "judgement goggles" off for a bit. I think this was a great, entertaining, and fun-loving movie. The CGI was great, you had Proxima, the Jaguar, the conquistadors (can't remember there names) but they were overtaken by the jungle and were made of snakes, bees, trees, etc. The rapids scene was awesomely beautiful. So sit back and enjoy the ride and for heaven's sake, just have fun with it.

title: Even worse than you could imagine
text: This is so long, so boring and so interesting I had to create an account just to warn people not to waste a second of their time. I was begging for it to end.

title: A fun movie
text: Entertaining movie for the whole family, Emily Blunt is very good. An easy, light watch.

title: Excellent Story with Good Acting.
text: Recommended to watch in halls. Excellent combination.

title: Jungle Amateur Chaos
text: Don't get me wrong, I love action movies, but this is an insult to the genre. The problem is the pace of the movie. It start fast and does not let up, without building any reason for you to sign on to struggle/adventure. You don't have a chance to understand why it's all happening. There is no reason for you to care because they give no reason to care. It's all happening so fast you can't keep up and in the end you don't care. The classic 'raiders of lost ark' (as an example) had moments at the beginning of the film to give reason and mystique about it all and the non stop action later on was built up and had reason for me be interested as well as delivering tension and dare. Some 40 minutes in I am struggling to care cause the film makers did not take the time to make it important plus happening so fast I can't follow what the hell is going on. It is the most cheapest shot of action ever, blindly watching scene to scene with thrills and spills with dramatic music but no emotional investment at all. Bad, Bad, Bad! You might as well disjointed and related scenes of action fro a sketch show. Whoever are responsible for this film should never make a film again and hopefully for the sake of film lovers should be rounded up and shot. Sorry folks for the distasteful violence in last comment but watching them being shot .. no matter how painful to humanity, how horrid it is .. I guarantee it is more enjoyable than this film.

title: The Mummy with Dad jokes
text: I didn't know what to expect with this movie, but was very pleasantly surprised. This is an enjoyable adventure movie that reminds me of 'The Mummy'. It has plenty of good gags and adventure. A very easy and enjoyable watch.

title: Worth watching only once
